Package chatapplication_server.components

Class ConfigManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • chatapplication_server.components.ConfigManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IComponent
    public class ConfigManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IComponent
    The ConfigManager components manages configuration values in the format [key, value]. This component loads config values given by the user during the execution of the ChatApplicationServer system.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      ConfigManager()
      Creates a new instance of ConfigManager

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ConfigManager getInstance()
        Implementation of the static getInstance() method. It ensures that only one instance of the ConfigManages component is active at any time.

      • getValue

        public java.lang.String getValue​(java.lang.String key)
        Method for getting a config value from the map given its key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to use for looking up the value
        Returns:
        A string with the stored value OR an empty string if no such key exists in the map

      • getValueInt

        public int getValueInt​(java.lang.String key)
        Method for getting a config value-as an integer- from the map given its key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to use for looking up the value.
        Returns:
        The int value of the key or 0 if not found

      • getValueLong

        public long getValueLong​(java.lang.String key)
        Method for getting a config value-as long integer- from the map given its key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to use for looking up the value.
        Returns:
        The long value of the key or 0 if not found

      • getValueFloat

        public float getValueFloat​(java.lang.String key)
        Method for getting a config value-as a float- from the map given its key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to use for looking up the value.
        Returns:
        The float value of the key or 0 if not found

      • setValue

        public void setValue​(java.lang.String key,
                     java.lang.String value)
        Set a config value from the map given its key. The method will overwrite any existing value already stored in the map with the given key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to use for looking up the value.
        value - The value to store in the map.

      • setDefaultValue

        public void setDefaultValue​(java.lang.String key,
                            java.lang.String value)
        If the given key does not already exist in the map, set it up with the given default key. This method is used by components to establish default values for the initial run of the application.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to use for looking up the value.
        value - The value to store in the map.
